author: The Telegraph
title: Australian recipe: tarragon and lemon roasted chicken
text: Looking for a gourmet getaway? Discover delicious food and fine wine in Australia » This is a recipe from Donna Hay's cookbook the new easy Ingredients Serves four 1.8kg chicken pieces on the bone 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil sea salt and cracked black pepper 10 small sprigs tarragon 1 tablespoon shredded lemon zest 3 cloves garlic, sliced 2 fennel bulbs, trimmed and sliced ½ cup (125ml) dry white wine ½ cup (125ml) chicken stock lemon wedges, to serve Method Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Heat a heavybased ovenproof casserole dish on a stovetop over high heat. Score the chicken skin at regular intervals, drizzle with the oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss to coat. Add to the dish and cook for 6-8 minutes each side or until well browned. Remove from the pan and set aside. Add the tarragon, lemon, garlic and fennel to the dish and cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Return the chicken to the dish with the wine and stock and bring to a simmer. Transfer to the oven and roast for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is just cooked through. Serve with lemon wedges.
